events.title: Defense Counsel Requests Epstein Medical Records
events.description: Defense attorneys Michael C. Miller and Martin G. Weinberg submit a letter and subpoena to the Metropolitan Correctional Center requesting all medical or mental health records of Jeffrey Epstein to investigate his death.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: The document references Epstein's death and the need to investigate its circumstances through his medical and mental health records.

events.title: Epstein's Incarceration at MCC

keyFacts: Defense counsel for Jeffrey Epstein is actively investigating the circumstances of his death by subpoenaing his medical and mental health records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The request is made under Rule 17(c) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure and legal authority from United States ex rel. Touhy v. Regan.
Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York while awaiting trial on federal charges in case 19-CRIM-00490.
The defense team includes attorneys Michael C. Miller of Steptoe & Johnson LLP and Martin G. Weinberg of his own firm.
The document establishes that Epstein's death occurred while he was in federal custody awaiting trial.
